description.narrative: The goal of the Counter Threat Network - Subject Matter Expert Exchange is to share best practices, knowledge, skills, and abilities related to the identification and analysis of networks that threaten partner countries' national security interests.

title.narrative: Ministry of Defense Advisors Program

description.narrative: The Ministry of Defense Advisors (MoDA) program partners senior Department of Defense (DoD) civilian experts with foreign counterparts to improve ministerial capacity. A MoDA is assisting the Thailand Ministry of Defense with defense planning reform initiatives. Long-term defense capacity building objectives are being achieved.

title.narrative: Indo-Pacific Maritime Security Initiative (MSI) - Thailand Upgrades and Reonovations to Utapao Airfield

description.narrative: The FY2016 National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) Section 1263 specifies seven Indo-Pacific Maritime Security Initiative (MSI) nations for assistance and training: Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Thailand, Vietnam, Sri Lanka, and Bangladesh. In addition, there is a provision that allows incremental expenses for personnel from Taiwan, Singapore and Brunei to participate in training. Country teams work through the Geographic Combatant Command (GCC) to nominate proposals to Office of the Secretary of Defense and the Joint Staff for approval. DSCA provides program management and execution through the implementing agencies.

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of Defense, Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide
Department of Defense, Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide

title.narrative: U.S. Department of Defense, Institutional Capacity Building Programs: Defense Institution Reform Initiative

description.narrative: Thailand - Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconaissance/Unmanned Aerial Vehicles/Martime. Support the Joint U.S. Military Advisory Group (JUSMAGTHAI), Thai Maritime Enforcement Coordination Center (MECC), and Royal Thai Navy (RTN) in planning, programming, budgeting and integration of Black Jack unmanned aerial system (UAS) within largely unknown but nascent Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (C4ISR) Architecture.

title.narrative: U.S. Department of Defense, Institutional Capacity Building Programs: Defense Institution Reform Initiative

description.narrative: Thailand - Royal Thai Army Modernization. Support the Royal Thai Army Logistics (G-4) integration of the Stryker armored vehcile into the force. Support the Joint Staff transition to a Functional Area Personnel Management system. Help support Joint US Military Group Thailand (JUSTMAGTHAI) in their effort with the Royal Thai Navy (RTN), the Thai Maritime Enforcement Coordination Center (Thai - MECC), and other agencies and stakeholders to produce an updated Maritime Security Strategy. Support and implement the Chief of Defense Forces desire for improved Joint Professional Military Education (JPME) to support career development.
